On february 2, 2015
[8356287]
Our story begins in a simple village,
in the wastelands of a simple world...

...a world without magic.

This is a roleplay with a planned story. There will be lots of exciting action and thrilling twists. The setting is a detailed world created as a collaboration by a team of very creative people:

(in no particular order)

EoNightcore Dragonice FlawlessSin greenbowers shadowlake @Miner101X Harrivchan Derpenstein Misterme7 DrWinner Versatio TsuTheLegend JinxMarshells Muttsterous

These are the Co-GMs of this story. We're members of a Twinoid Group called Advanced Story-Gaming. We're very diverse, but we accept each other as-is, and we all get along great. We really just love to roleplay and write stories together. We have over a dozen active threads and we can easily crank out 1000 posts in a couple of days.

If you're interested in joining, look no further. Simply create a character and join this story. Once we get to know you, if we like the way you roleplay, we'll invite you into the group.


RULES:

Each player has exclusive control of one character. You can be anything that would fit in a Medieval or Renaissance world. Humans only. You cannot be a villain, although your character's personality is yours to define however you wish.

Do not use dice to attack. No auto-hits. Simply describe what you're ATTEMPTING to do. The target of the attack gets to decide the outcome. The target player may choose to use dice to decide the outcome, if they wish.

NPCs and the environment can only be controlled by the GMs (listed above). NPCs can auto-hit PCs, if necessary for the plot. Any GM can control any NPC at any time. Each GM can also have one PC.


CHARACTER SHEET:

  • Name
  • Gender
  • Appearance
  • Occupation
  • Personality
  • Relations to other characters
  • Back-story

Name: Grendon Sansel

Backstory: His fathers fathers fathers fathers fathers mother was the daughter...Of a farmer. Everyone in the family tree WORKS ON THIS FARM. ALL OF THEM.

Oh? His upbringing? Well, he worked on the farm. A lot. Not much learning. Just. Just farm.

Relations to other characters: he become friends of most of the folks used to visit the Town Tavern. Hides a "secret" love, one the most common story told at the late hours, for a mysterious Isabella, and he has a small picture of her (really bad draw, could be a woman or a rural environment)

Back-story: Never met his parents, was grown up by the local Innkeeper that's call him "his best dish" (but actually very careful to avoid him to enter the refectory) Never been at school and this explain why so bad at english grammar

On february 3, 2015
MadDonut

Name: Alexander "Hands" Pitmier
Gender: Male
Age: 17
Appearance: His auburn hair is short and swept to the left. His sideburns has a royal aesthetic to them. His facial hair is still but a stubble, being rather young. His clothes are form-fitting, and never loose or baggy. He has on a white shirt beneath his basic brown coat. His darkly colored breeches are tucked into his tightened black leather boots.
Occupation: Petty theif, swindler, does odd-jobs occasionally.
Personality: Manipulative of others and eager to make a quick buck. If he sees something he wants, he'll take it. Demands things to go his way. He has a taste for luxury, but is quick to deny it. Often stubborn and defiant, he has trouble making friends too quickly. Besides all this, he is a clever actor and can appear however he wishes to others to get what he wants.
Relations to other characters: Son of a rich noble, Desmond Pitmier (age 43) brother to his family's male heir, Gundar Pitmier (age 14.5); brother to his sisters Anabelle (6) and Alexanderia Pitmier (7). His mother, Joanne Pitmier (died at age 32), died from childbirth. Carter Pitmier (died upon birth), was his late brother.
Back-story: Being raised on the estate of a wealthy life, Alex has a cushy life with few worries. In his youth he was mischievous, and possibly a sufferer of kleptomania. He would take and hoard whatever he could get his hands on. His father was often absent, being a lord of the land having political and military presence in the lands around him. His father was hardworking and diligent, but was honest and as fair as situations would let him be. Being a troublemaker, he had to be watched constantly. Also being the eldest meant he spent much time with his mother and grew very close to her. She was very caring and gentle. She never yelled or hit him, yet he respected and loved her.
Her death hit him perhaps the hardest. His father continued to be cold and distant. He pushed Alex to go to school and become more politically active. Alexander, coping with his mother's death, turned more and more rebellious and used thievery as a way to comfort himself. There was a few cases where his father had to bail him from jail and would yell at him to clean his act. Eventually, his father sent him off to a militaristic private school where Alex learned to read and write sophisticated English (technically Latin in the real time period), horse riding, archery, stratigism, and fighting. Alex ignored the more academic classes and focused on the more physical skills like archery, fighting (swords, wrestling, boxing, etc), and horse riding.
After a year of concentrated studies, Alexander ran away from that school. His father put a (what is equivalent to..) $10,000 search for him, but after a failed month of waiting, he disowned his son and retracted the reward. Alex joined an unimpressive group of bandits that broke up internally. Eventually his travels landed him in this village. Here he comes now, walking in on the main road with a bag of stolen foods and trinkets over his shoulder.

Occupation: Traveler
Personality: Lazy, but friendly
Relations to other characters: Travels to this Village often for supplies.

Because he tends to travel to other villages, villagers will often give him messages to send or even merchandise for him to sell. He is on good terms with most bandits, mostly because he knows juicy information about their rivals. Never the less, he often loses any gold he has because of them. His true name is not known, and something he would rather not talk about.

On february 3, 2015
[8356287]

True, this is a non-magical fantasy world. Culture and technology are similar to Medieval or Renaissance era.

Here's a brief summary of the setting:

  • Small village in the wastelands, population ~100
  • Semi-arid climate, rocky terrain, sparse vegetation
  • Surrounded by ore mines and farms that raise exotic fruits
  • Most of the villagers are farmers, miners, and craftspeople
  • Everyone knows almost everyone else
  • They hunt crab-like creatures called scuttlers that burrow in the sand

The only required change is that there's no such thing as magic.

But feel free to update your character in any other way you think would help them fit into this setting. That's up to you.

•Back-story: Conner, who prefers to be called Mortimer, had alway wanted to heal the sick. When he was a small lad he was shunned by his village for his strange, beliefs in alternative healing techniques ( Which resulted in some deaths ) so he left his village. In the woods he found his life long friend Charles D. Mortimer who took him in because he too had the passion for healing. Charles taught him almost everything he knows about healing. He was hung do to his outrageous prices for healing and the fact that it didn't work most of the time... Conner traveled the land and somehow settled down in this small village.
On february 3, 2015
[8356287]

Here's a bit more about the setting:

  • The wastelands are within the borders of the nation of Asgain, although the nobles usually don't concern themselves with the barren frontier.
  • There's no regional government. The wastelands are lawless and wild.
  • The village is a tribal chiefdom led by elders.
  • The Chief is the oldest at age 55. (Low life-expectancy here.)
  • Mining operations are extensive, with railways to carry iron and copper ores from the mines to the village, hauled by animals.
  • The local deity is Nolin, god of the Earth element.
  • Strice Festival - a ritual of gratitude to Nolin for the Earth's bounty in their harvests, mines, and hunts. There's a ceremony, a huge feast, then music and dancing.

Main foods:

  • Scuttlers (see above)
  • Impka - a sweet fruit with a white, prickly rind
  • Maasic - a horse-like creature with a melodic voice
  • Swoomp Berry - spicy orange berries that grow on cacti

[8356287]

Well, in a non-magical world, most people don't believe in magic. It's up to each player to decide what their own character believes. As for the NPCs, we can have a few of them believe, sure...


So let's go ahead and get started!


First, some things you need to know:

This story is not about winning. You're going to lose sometimes. Be cool about it.

Our style of roleplay is quick and interactive. I know it can be fun to write in-depth narrative exposition, but try to keep your posts short. If you do post something long, please include a TL;DR summary of what's important.

We also sometimes have multiple scenes going at the same time, so remember to quote whatever you're responding to, if it's not the most recent post.

If the pace is too fast to keep up with, try not to get frustrated. We can give you a summary of what you've missed, if you don't have time to read it all.



We'll begin on THE DAY BEFORE the festival, to do some "slice of life" character development before we jump into the action.

  • What would your character do on a normal day?
  • Who would they meet?
  • What would they talk about?

NEW RULE:

I will control the passage of time. From now on, all interactive roleplay must be synchronized with the "current time," which I will periodically announce. You can post summary descriptions of past events, but do not RP in the past, and do not advance into the future.

- You can fill in gaps you missed while AFK.

- But all interactions and dialogue must fit into the current time.

All previous events occurred in the past.
We are now synchronized in the present.

Alexander "Hands" Pitmier had indeed returned to the tavern and assisted the Barkeeper with washing mugs, refilling barrels, and wiping tables in return for a place to rest.

Hands still was up to his hijinks as he overpriced drinks and pocketed coins for himself. However, he only managed to snatch 5 extra coins before the already suspicious bartender noticed how upset customers were getting. From then on, the Barkeeper forbid him from talking to customers and threatened to kick him out into the streets. Hands, of course, made a convincing argument and was allowed to stay for now, despite the Barkeeper's reluctance. However, he was on very thin ice.

Tending to the wound on his leg, Hands had wrapped a white bandage around his knee. While he could jog, it hurt to sprint and even more so to jump or land.

Hanging about the bar and still pretending to be a reporter, Hands eventually learned about the annual scuttler hunt and the upcoming Strive Festival. Both having to play his part as Gerald Knottingham (Hands) and looking to see what he could get away with, he headed towards the gather group of scuttler hunters.
He had left his sack hidden in his room back at the tavern and locked the door.

MadDonut

Hands leans against a table in the cellar where all the alcohol is kept, with a half-empty mug of ale in one hand and a sheet of charts in the other. A single candle glows from the table behind him, illuminating his surroundings with a flickering orange hue and casts his shadow against the wall. He holds the paper at his knee in his right hand as he sips his swiped beverage, secretly filled when the Bartender was not looking. He looks at the stacked wall of wooden kegs before him and back at the paper, attempting to take inventory after a drink too many.

Hands places his drink on the table behind him as he scoots off of it and walks towards the kegs. He kneels down and presses his cheek against one, inspecting it. He taps on one with his knuckles and listens to the fluid rock and the echo inside vibrate. He stands up straight again, yawning, and scratches his head.

Hands follows this with a shrug and returns to the table. He takes a quick swig of his drink, getting used to the taste, and lifts a quill out of an ink bottle. He quickly estimates how much is left in the containers and forges a little extra, to hide his beer theft.

Hands downs the rest of his drink and hides the cup for his future use again. He slips the paper into the ledger and closes the heavy book. Then he heads for the stairs and grabs the broom he left propped up at the first step. He begins to head up as he stiffles a burp with his hand.

Hands takes the broom and begins sweeping out front of the tavern, where the Bartender won't be able to tell he's been drinking. He whistles a simple song, with 54% of the notes hitting their timing and pitch perfectly.

Hands finishes sweeping out front and reenters the tavern. Still buzzed, he avoids the direct gaze of the Barkeeper. What his own eyes set upon, however, is a sharp hunting knife someone left on one of the tables. He walks over and picks it up with a curious expression. He brings the blade to his left forearm and glides the blade across a hairy section. The knife swiftly shaves off a few hairs, proving it's sharpness.

Hands then sits down in one of the chairs and chews his cheek a little as flattens his left hand on the table, spreading out all of his fingers. He gently taps the knife behind his thumb nail and slowly carries it over the thumb and taps the table on the other side. He then, very slow and focused manner, returns the knife behind his thumb and softly taps again.

Hands repeats this with every space beside each finger in the same slow pace, returning to his thumb each time. As he crosses over to the left of his pinky, he accidentally knicks the skin and causes a small cut. He lifts his hand to his mouth and sucks the blood, afterwards shaking his hand in pain. A few of the bar patrons have been casually watching him as he practiced, and at that moment, one of them chuckled under his breath.

Hands quickly gave him a dirty look, perhaps even challenging him silently, as he continued to practice in a novice fashion, never breaking his gaze. The bearded fellow shifted uncomfortably in his seat as he was stared at. Someone muffles a cough and a few distracting conversations about work or weather spring up, but the bearded man stays quiet, rapping his fingers against his mug.

Hands has a small round table set up near the Barkeeper's tent where he, again, is using a lost hunting knife to play Five Finger Fillet. He still maintains a leisurely demeanor as the knife softly taps the wood surface every few seconds. A couple of tavern regulars, one of them the bearded man that laughed at Hands last night, are chit-chatting with each other, making fun of Hands's poor performance. Occasionally they'll yell out an insult or towards him, but each time they do, Hands simply looks up and stares at the bearded fellow with a fiery gaze. The bearded man's nerves tighten and he hushes for a bit before joining his friend in more banter later.

The Barkeeper allows Hands to play his game only because he promised to help clean up and carry everything after the festival. However, the incessant tapping drives him a bit mad.

Hands hums softly to the tune of the slowly tapping knife, focused on his game and no longer cutting himself. He still looks at the bearded man every once in awhile, still challenging him silently to make a move.

Bearded Man"You won't get anywhere if you don't speed up, lad!"Hands decided to say something back. In a cool and calm manner, he replies:
Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"What a funny coincidence. That's also what your mother said last night."The bearded man took offense to that.
Bearded Man"OI! You little snarlving runt! I'll beat your damn head in!"
He storms up to the table with his friend trailing behind him, laughing and generally acting as his hype man.
Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"How about we make a bet? If I can get through all my fingers quicker than you can without cutting myself, I win. If I can't keep up or cut myself, you win. Whaddya say, you in?"The bearded man and his friend laugh.
Bearded Man"Sure pup. I'll play your little game. Whatcha bettin'?"Hands reaches into the bag by his feet and pulls out the silver candlestick and fancy silverware.
Bearded Man"Well, well, well. What fancy trinkets you got there. Since I see your serious about this, I'll match you. Then, I raise you."

The bearded man pulls out a sack and empties 20+16 coins on the table. He pulls out his own knife, a mediocre working blade with his initials on the handle, S.B..

Hands nods at this and lifts up his knife. He pauses for a second before brining it down again.
Tap..... Tap..... Tap.....
The man laughs and grins at how slowly Hands moves.
S.B."Let me show you how it's done.."Tap... Tap... Tap...
Hands smirks as S.B. completes it at a modest rate. He sets down his knife and pops his knuckles, stirring more laughter from the men.
S.B.'s Friend"You're never going to beat him! Might as well just give us the goods."Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"Very well then, you can just have my share of the bet."Hands goods slides the silver goods over to S.B.'s side of the table. The friend picks them up and enjoys their twinkle.Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"Now let a professional show you how it's done."Here's three facts about Alexander "Hands" Pitmier.
1. He was born ambidexterious and with hyperdexterity (meaning he has independent control of each of his fingers).
2. Five Finger Fillet is Hands's favorite game and a hobby he's had since he was ten and was mainly all he did in the back of his boring classes, much to the annoyance of his teachers.
3. He has never lost a game of Five Finger Fillet.
Bonus fact: It was a girl that first gave him the nickname "Hands", for entirely different reasons...
Tap Tap Tap
The blade glided back and forth rapidly over his hand, and he flawlessly finishes by stabbing the table and planting the knife.
Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"Your turn."S.B. appears flustered for a moment and his friend is dead quite. He growls and picks up his knife, desperate to defend his pride.S.B."That's nothin'!"Tap.. Tap.. AAAARGH!
S.B. slices open his hand between his thumb and finger. Blood spurts out on the table before he can cover the wound with his other hand. He swears and curses at Hands for about a minute before his friend finally pulls him away, telling him he needs stitches.

Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"Perhaps you should practice more!"Hands watches them walk away, leaving the coins on the table for Hands to collect. He chuckles as he pockets the coins and returns to his slow mannered practice, hoping to hustle more chumps to play against him.

TD;DR: Hands plays Five Finger Fillet and challenges the bearded man he's been aggrivating. He discovers the man's initials, S.B., and defeats him. S.B.'s hand is badly cut and he and his friend go find a doctor, leaving a small sum of betting money for Hands to take. Hands has returned to his previous casual pattern, waiting for more challengers.

MadDonut

Hands is busily enjoying his meal of fried eggs when suddenly two fists slam on the table, causing his plate to jitter. Hands looks up to see it was S.B.'s friend, unacompanied by SB himself.

The man was glaring and at Hands from across the table. His fiery eyes burned below his bushy brows and a hefty satchel was slung over his left shoulder. A short sword was hung on the left side of his hip.
SB's Friend"Give Sam his money back, you cheat."Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"I won it fair and square. Now quit pestering me while I'm trying to eat my eggs."Hands returns his focus to the plater before him and delicately cuts open his second egg. Warm, yellow yolk ran out, just as Alex's mother used to make them. Upset about being ignored, Sam B's friend walks around and stands closer to Hands. Suddenly, he reaches over and flings the plate of eggs over and off the table, splatting and cracking on dry dirt ground.

Sam B's Friend"Return what you took before you end up broken as welll," he threatens.Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"You just ruined a perfectly good meal, you know that?"Sam B's Friend"Oh boo hoo. Go cry to your mum 'bout it."Hands took offense to that.

A fist quickly shoots up and smashes into the man's face. The man staggers for a moment, holding his right hand above his lip and withdrawing it to see the tips stained crimson red. He snorts in anger, causing blood drops to 'shotgun' from his nose and spill on the ground.Sam B's Friend"You'll regret that, scuttler scum.." Sam B's friend charges at Hands, his right hand balled in a fist, but Hands quickly dodges and kicks Sam B's Friend's right leg out from under him. Sam B's friend smashes his left cheek against the table and falls to the floor, in pain.

Hands is quick to climb on top of him, pulling out his hunting dagger and holding it to the man's neck.Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"Ruin my meal, huh? How about I ruin your face to where even your mother wouldn't recognize you?" Sam B's friend squirms in terror as Hands cuts the strap of his satchel, torturing him, and unhooks his sword's sheath from his waist before letting him go. The man runs off immediately, his left cheek all red and swollen. He runs past Honral and Konrad.

Hands check out his loot. Inside the satchel is the silver candlestick and utensils Hands had given him, two work boots, a spare shirt, and a basic leather cap. Examining the weapon, it was a plain iron swortsword that needed sharpening and was a bit worn at the handle, yet it was light and reliable.

Hands puts the sword around his waist and puts the contents of the satchel into his sack, when he got an idea. He picked up the silver candle stick, put on the cap and changed his shirt, removed his jacket, and scavenged a couple of nearby candles. He then walks back over towards the dating couple, a lit silver candlestick in hand.

Before they quite notice him, Hands slides the candlestick across the table, perfectly stopping dead in the middle and between the two lovebirds. As they look up where the candle slide in from, he's gone again. Hands has already quickly snuck past the table and around the house, finding and snatching a killed scuttler when no one was looking. He prepares to walk back to the table, but not yet..

Bells ring out through the village, announcing the beginning of the Strice Festival ceremony. Villagers begin to gather around the Shrine of Nolin. The Village Chief is standing in front, waiting for everyone to arrive before he begins.

[8356287]

The Chief looked out at the crowd. Most of them were familiar faces, but there were quite a few visitors, too. Once everyone had arrived, he began his speech:

Griff Josef, Village Chief

Welcome, friends. We be gathered here to celebrate and give thanks for the bounty of Earth in the blessings of Nolin. What a prosperous year it be!

And yet, our hearts be heavy with the loss of our great hunters, Redrick and Jatka. May they return to Earth and go with Nolin, who giveth and taketh in equal measure.

There be rumors amongst ye that the Shalak'Ti was commanded by Niali warriors. Y'all settle down. I ain't never heard no such thing as a sand shark takin' orders. Them dirty heathens may hate the good Lord Nolin, but there ain't no demon what give them such powers on the mighty beasts of Earth.

Most of y'all not be knowin' the history between our peoples. Ya ought to... listen up.

Long ago, in the time of legends, when the gods and demons walked among men, we was all one folk in this here land. Then Almighty Nolin appeared and delivered unto us the holy Orb of Earth, which be enshrined here before us to this very day.

But the heretics rose up and cursed the name of Nolin, and they were cast out to suffer in the endless dunes. Them's the Niali, our lost bretheren. We must never lose hope that one day they shall change their ways, and our peoples be reunited as one.

Now, let us be startin' the ceremony. Heads of household, step forward with your offerings. Enter ye the Shrine of Nolin and kneel before the Orb of Earth to give our thanks.

And to our visitors, ye need not join in. This ancient tradition is for the faithful only.

In the age-old custom of the village, the Chief's offering is a lock of hair from each one of the villagers who had died that year - nine of them in total. He shed a tear as he gave thanks for their lives.

One by one, the other villagers approached the shrine to make their offering and give thanks.

One by one the villagers came, bearing gifts of fruit and meat, nuggets of ore, fine crafts, and coinage. The Chief nodded somberly to each, and waited for them all to finish. Then he smiled at the crowd and motioned toward the rows of tables under the tent.

Chief GriffRight.... LET'S EAT!

The villagers cheered and rushed over to the feast. Some of them gathered up all the food offerings and brought them to the tables. Griff took the coinage, some of the crafts, and Konrad's sword. Then he went to each one of the poorer villagers and gave them each a bit of money or something they needed, until everything had been given away - everything except the sword.

Then he slowly approached Honral and Konrad and extended the sword with both hands.

Chief GriffI figure old Nolin be lookin' down on ye with pride, lad. And I reckon ye be needin' this to defend me daughter in these wild lands.

Honral, dear, I'm so sorry ye be hoppin' round, less a leg. I'll see to it ye get a proper peg fitted, aye? On me own pocketbook, lass - please honor this old man to look after his kin.

And it fills me heart with joy that ye thinkin' on settlin' down, after all these years. I give ye both me blessings.

MadDonut

Jackpot.

Hands smoothly slides 11 coins right into his satchel. Anything shiny he sees is now his. He gets a pair of worn gloves, a gold tooth, a decorative goblet, three silver enscribed rings, a bent chisel, a pair of unused baby shoes, and a dirty nugget of a poorly value ore. Unfortunately, most of the items had been already given away, especially the food, clothes, and other necessities, so the haul was not truly too intense. However, Hands had a happy mood, for stealing simply soothed his soul.

Hands made his way back to his table, acting normal and as uninteresting as he could be. He slide the satchel under the table, out of mind and out of sight. Perhaps, if their little tribal god did indeed exist, he'd suffer some divine punishment, but for now Hands leaned back in his chair and played with his hunting knife, smiling mildly at his successful antics.

Alexander "Hands" Pitmier"*cough* I'm okay. Just went down the wrong pipe," he says with a pained smile. Hands suddenly remember maasics. There was many that were raised on the fields of his father's estate. They would sing and sound so sweetly in the spring breeze. His father had hired a trainer to teach them to sing whole songs together. On special occasions, like on twelfth birthday (the year in which his mother died later on), they sang the tune of Happy Birthday to him, and at his cousin's wedding they sang, oh so beautifully.

Hands's father was a strong admirer of the magnificent animals and had given Hands his own maasic, named Goldfoot, again, at his twelfth birthday. It was still a young maasic, but its size grew along with Hands and the two of them rode about the property for fun. His mother and father both owned maasics, however his mother was not as much of a fan of the animals. She did however accompany Hands on many rides just to spend time with him. After being sent to school, Goldfoot was transfered there to the stables so that Hands could see him and ride him during his more fight-focused horse riding lessons. The two made a great team, but Hands had left Goldfoot behind when he ran away, something he regrets for both practical and personal reasons.

Hands's mood was soiled, past memories being brought up again. He ate slowly, unable to eat the roast anymore. He somberly looked at the meat for a moment, shedding a single tear. He quickly wipes it away and musters up courage to continue his positive charade.

MadDonut

Hands choked on his spoon, still sitting at a table and getting addicted to the strice fruit pudding.
The Princess of Asgain? Here?! he spat out his spoon as his mind panicked in confusion. Why would she be here? This miserable village has nothing to offer.

Hands remembered her from when he had attended a ball when he was 8 and a half years old. He was forced to go by his father and made to do all sorts of dancing with princesses and daughters of wealthy men. His father was busy trying to make a big a political impression, as well as coax his son early into some royal romance.

Hands wanted nothing of these girls in their poofy dresses, plagued with cooties, (only at the time..), and was more distracted by the shimmering chandelier and the honey-shined utensils. In fact, he even stole a gold spoon that he still has locked in his personal box in his room somewhere. He doubts she would remember him, being seven years later and such a short, uninterested dance.
But you know those royalty types, remembering every face and name just to please the people.

Hands kept his head low in his strice fruit pudding, seriously hoping she wouldn't notice him.

Head hung low and his walk in a bit of wander, Hands forced himself to look at his feet as he remembers his father's lesson.Desmond Pitmier"A soldier never looks at the battleground during or after a fight. Gazing upon lost comrades and ruined lives can turn a rock heart to clay."

"Stay focused, eyes forward, and blade towards thy enemy."

"Fight to avenge the comrades you lost and live to help your friends tomorrow."
